data.title: I had a GREAT sandwich here!
data.text: Big, warm, cheesy sandwich! very very good! Coffee was good too!  I had to wait a bit since there was only one person working.  But , I wasn't in a hurry and it was worth it!

data.title: Amazing coffee in Gastonia
data.text: Varies varieties, comfy atmosphere, very affordable, and you can be very productive yourself here. The staff is very friendly. Park across the street it is FREE!!

data.title: Vintage Coffee House plus Adult Beverages
data.text:
Zoe's is your proto-typical #neverStarbucks coffee house. It has your overstuffed chairs, sofas, small stage for the musicians, and the godawful The Christmas Story Leg Table Lamp. So just about perfect and everything you want in something-not-Starbucks. 

Besides cold and hot coffee drinks, you'll find a full bar, and a menu of sandwiches, salads, and appetizers. If you're lucky like I was, you'll have the delightful and engaging Marissa serving your food and drinks.

This was just a quick stop for me so no food, but the the as Sunrise Wrap or The Greek Gatsby sandwich certainly sounded appetizing. 
Recommended.

data.title: Eclectic
data.text: Cool coffee house reminiscent of the ones from the 1970's . Open mic nights, live music, cold beers and mixed drink. The crowd is most younger people so there is lots of energy.  I enjoy going to people watch and just hang out in the relaxed atmosphere .

data.title: Cute, eclectic coffee shop
data.text: Stopped this afternoon with three other folks for an excellent cup of coffee. Staff was friendly; coffee was good. Cute place to hang and they have entertainment on certain nights.

data.title: The Place downtown to get a cup of Coffee or a Drink, meal, listen to local Music, or just hang
data.text: Zoe's Coffee house is more than just for Coffee, you can get a mixed drink, snack or meal.  A place to take in a local Music group, listen to poetry, or just hang with friends.  I have visited here for Jazz and just to relax and have a drink

data.title: It's like you're in Asheville!
data.text: This place is awesome! It's like someone plucked it out of Asheville and then dropped it in Gastonia. The atmosphere is relaxed, yet unique. There's lots of cool nooks and crannies you can find to hang out in. They serve awesome beer on tap - and some great wines too.

data.title: Great place for coffee and dessert
data.text: The coffee was great and I had a piece of coconut cake that was out of this world. It's such a neat place and cozy. My friends and I went back the next day and had lunch. Great food.

data.title: Young Crowd Coffee shop
data.text: A young crowd place. A variety of coffees and drinks are available. They have entertainment from local artists. Have been there a few times to listen to the performers. They do have food but have not tried it. Thinking it's more along the lines of pastries and such.

data.title: Nice funky coffee house.
data.text: My wife and I stop here on Saturday morning outtings.  Good coffee and nice elcectric interior.  They also serve adult beverages and appear to have stuff going on in the evenings.

data.title: Chill outside or Enjoy Live Music inside
data.text: Enjoy herbal teas, lattes, flavored coffees, and more. Sit with friends to play games on a comfy couch or just hang out for one of the numerous live music performances. We love it here and you will too!

data.title: great place to have coffee
data.text: lots of fun in a coffee shop. coffee and live music... great place to hang out and talk to friends and hear some live music and relax. they also have cakes.

data.title: Salad and Cookie - don't judge me
data.text: Came in for a water and a snack - the cookies were very good! Pecan Coconut and Oatmeal Raisin were my selections. I decided to have the Boba Feta Salad - very tasty and filling! Very pretty surroundings and atmosphere. Stop in if you want to relax and enjoy yourself.

data.title: Coffee and a great selections of sandwich
data.text:
bottomless coffee in real mugs and great sandwiches.  

try the sunrise and your have to try - Axel's Redbanger - the banana sauce on it really compliments the spicy peperoni.

data.title: Went there for the band, was fun.
data.text: We went to Zoe's to see the Black Coffee Trio band. They were very good, by the way. Zoe's is nothing special, but the employees are pleasant and they served good drinks. Prices of the drinks for reasonable.  We had a party of 5 and were there for about 2 hours. We did not eat, but the menu looked simple and they had some unique items I would have liked to try. Overall, a good place.

data.title: Had some good wine, but the fruit fly's will keep us away...
data.text:
Eclectic little place in downtown Gastonia.
Folks running it were friendly and courteous, huge selection of beer from all over the world.
However the critters were too friendly, meaning the pesky fruit fly's were everywhere.
cannot stand those things, they need to do something about them like now!
Won't be back until the critters are evicted!

data.title: Good Coffee Shop
data.text: Finally had the opportunity to check this place out today. I passed by a couple of Sundays ago and it was closed and now I know why. It is more than a coffee shop in that they also serve alcohol and thus probably turn into more of a nightclub than a coffee shop in the evenings and are open to 1 or 2 AM M-Sat. This is a wise business decision for the present as downtown Gastonia has been trying to rebuild and remodel its mostly vacant downtown structures for the past 15 years or so after the demise of the textile industry. The coffee menu has a good basic representation that one would expect at an average coffee shop. The building itself has high ceilings and is a perfect example of adaptive reuse that is anticipated for other Gastonia buildings. There is also a stage with music stands and mics so obviously there is live music at least occasionally. I will make an effort to see to what extent the mood changes in Zoe's in the evenings.

data.title: Amazing!
data.text: Okay so I have never been here myself... but!! I have a close friend whom I work with, that has been depressed for some time now. She finally found (ZOE'S) a place where she belongs and found people of her interest. She smiles now and We dont worry about her as much, THANK YOU ZOE'S. The friends she has made from here mean alot to all of those she works with!

data.title: Great place to hang out
data.text: I have only had coffee/tea but i think its a cool place.  Nice and comfortable to either read or have a talk.  Service is very fast and friendly.  Nice selection of beverages.

data.title: It's not Central Perk, but it's perfect for us.
data.text: In the tv show Friends the group had Central Perk, we have Zoe's. In the heart of downtown Gastonia, Across from the courthouse is a funky little coffee shop. It's eclectic from the decor to the customers as well as what they are drinking or eating! This is usually our "YAY,  we made it through the week. HAPPY FRIDAY"  place to go!  It's busy at times, but not crowded. I am vegan. Yummy desserts to eat even for me, my daughter loves the big fat muffins! My gluten/dairy free friend has choices too. In all honesty this is not a cheap place for a cuppa...but this is 2014 and we Americans pay for our coffee fix no matter where we go. I think it's a fair price. Do I want it to become a BIG, BUSY place. Uhm no. It's perfect just as it is. Lawyers popping in, artists too, and did I mention...they have beer and spirits? Yep...that's not my thing really. Oh, and the management keeps things happening. Open mic night, stitcher, hookers night, (yep crochet and knitters welcome), movie nights, etc. etc.
